page.title: 06PURSTON JAGLIN
page.content: Purston Jaglin is a large mining community which is based upon the two nearby collieries of Ackton Hall and Featherstone. Most of the houses in the area are on council estates although a few of them are privately owned. The majority of the houses are built of red brick and are heated by solid fuel. The smoke from the coal fires produces a gloomy outlook to what is otherwise a pleasant and friendly area. Although the mining industry provides most of the employment in the area, there is also a large soft drinks factory in the town which employs approximately 80 people, mainly female.
